data.title: Off the Record with Mitch Daniels
data.meta_description: In this episode of Indiana 250 Off the Record, host Nate Feltman talks with former Indiana Governor and Purdue University President Mitch Daniels. The discussion revolves around Daniels’ illustrious career, including his roles with Senator Richard Lugar, Chief Political Advisor to President Ronald Reagan and Director of the Office of Management and Budget under President George W. Bush. Daniels discusses his work as Indiana's Governor, his transformative tenure at Purdue University, and his insights on the future of Indiana. The conversation also touches on ideas to further Indiana’s economic development and Daniels’ post-Purdue retirement activities.
